cab.content: (THIS POCUMSNT IS THE PROPERTY Og HIS BRITaHfllO MAJESTY^ GOVERNMENT).EJB 0 R E T. Lp.-1876.CABINS ToCO-OEBRATIOfl BY THE DOMINIONS Iil SUPPLYING vd-IITETROOPS ABROAD.Paraphrase telegram from the Officer Administering State for the Colonies.(Received Colonial Office 18*5 p.nu September 30t,h,.1920). (Hgferenoei -t Cabinet J5I ,(20), Conclusion 3)* I devious Papers - C.P^ 1843, 1844. 1871 and 1875).leoret and Personal.,I have'' personally discussed with my Prime Minister the contents of your telegram of the 18th September secret and fc.P*1075a personal.^ My Prime Minister asks me to reply that he has consulted his colleagues who think with him that without any difficulty volunteers sufficient for a battalion would be forthcoming. Before taking action he will await further advice from you,, Please telegraph whether infantry or mounted men are required, New Zealand will bear the cost of any troops going from this Dominion.STOUT.Whitehall Gardens, 3.W.I. September 20th, 1920.
